system.description:
This spell-song grants the bard the ability to perceive distant locations, much like a crystal ball.

Effects:

  • Allows the bard to see a location up to five miles away.
  • The bard must know the name of the location and provide a brief description to focus on it.
  • The bard can rotate their point of view up to 360 degrees but cannot move.
  • By naming new locations, the bard can switch views within the spellâ€™s duration, though this is less precise than a wizard eye.

Limitations:

  • The bard cannot see through solid objects.
  • Locations protected by magical wards or enchantments are blocked.
  • The bard enters a trance-like state while the spell is active, completely unaware of their surroundings.
  • If the bard takes any damage, their concentration is broken and the spell immediately ends.
system.effect: Allows the bard to remotely view distant locations
